title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 4. Article 13 of the Principal Scheme is amended by inserting the following
text_raw:
4. Article 13 of the Principal Scheme is amended by inserting the following 

after Article 13(2): 

“(2a) Where an applicant enters a course listed in Part C of Schedule 2 of 
the Regulations, their class is defined at the first point of entry to this course 
or at his or her point of re-entry to this course and will continue to apply for 
the duration of his or her studies.”
text_norm: 4 article 13 principal scheme amended inserting following article 13(2) (2a) applicant enters course listed part c schedule 2 regulation class defined first point entry course point re-entry course continue apply duration study

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 5. Article 13(7) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the
text_raw:
5. Article 13(7) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the 

following: 

“(7) Where a second chance student has attended a course below 
undergraduate level during the 3 year break in studies, with the exception of 
the approved courses prescribed in Part C of Schedule 2 of the Regulations, 
he or she is regarded as satisfying the conditions of paragraph 6(a), subject 
to the rules of progression as provided for in this Scheme and Section 2 of 
the Act.”
text_norm: 5 article 13(7) principal scheme amended substituting following (7) second chance student attended course undergraduate level 3 year break study exception approved course prescribed part c schedule 2 regulation regarded satisfying condition paragraph 6(a) subject rule progression provided scheme section 2 act

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 6. Article 15(7)(a)(i) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting
text_raw:
6. Article 15(7)(a)(i) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting 

the following: 

“(i) be required to complete an equivalent period of study on an approved 
post leaving certificate course, with the exception of an applicant 
commencing an approved course listed in Part C of Schedule 2 of the 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 8th September, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [426] 3 

Regulations for the first time, before being eligible to be considered for a 
grant, or”

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 7. Article 15(7)(b)(v) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting
text_raw:
7. Article 15(7)(b)(v) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting 

the following: 

“(v) be eligible to be considered for a grant to pursue an approved 
postgraduate course, or”
text_norm: 7 article 15(7)(b)(v) principal scheme amended substituting following (v) eligible considered grant pursue approved postgraduate course

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 8. Article 15(7)(b) of the Principal Scheme is amended by inserting the
text_raw:
8. Article 15(7)(b) of the Principal Scheme is amended by inserting the 

following after 15(7)(b)(v): 

“(vi) be required to complete an equivalent period of study on one of the 
approved courses listed in Part C of Schedule 2 of the Regulations and, 
where the repeat period of study is longer than that course, be required to 
complete the remainder of the repeat period on one of the approved courses 
listed in Part D of Schedule 2 of the Regulations, before being eligible to be 
considered for a grant.”

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 13. Article 15(10)(a) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the
text_raw:
13. Article 15(10)(a) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the 

following: 

“(a) Post leaving certificate courses: 

— Grant aid shall be limited to a maximum of three years in total, 
with the exception of a student who commences one of the approved 
courses prescribed in Part C of Schedule 2 of the Regulations, in 
which case grant aid shall be limited to a maximum of five years in 
total;”
text_norm: 13 article 15(10)(a) principal scheme amended substituting following (a) post leaving certificate course -- grant aid shall limited maximum three year total exception student commences one approved course prescribed part c schedule 2 regulation case grant aid shall limited maximum five year total

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 14. Article 16(2) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the
text_raw:
14. Article 16(2) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the 

following: 

“(2) A student pursuing an approved post leaving certificate course, with 
the exception of a student commencing an approved course prescribed in 
Part C of Schedule 2 of the Regulations for the first time, is ineligible for a 
grant if he or she already holds a further education qualification at Level 5 
or 6 of the framework of qualifications, or a third level qualification at or 
above Level 6 of the framework of qualifications, or equivalent 
qualifications.”
text_norm: 14 article 16(2) principal scheme amended substituting following (2) student pursuing approved post leaving certificate course exception student commencing approved course prescribed part c schedule 2 regulation first time ineligible grant already hold education qualification level 5 6 framework qualification third level qualification level 6 framework qualification equivalent qualification

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 15. Article 16 of the Principal Scheme is amended by inserting the following
text_raw:
15. Article 16 of the Principal Scheme is amended by inserting the following 

after Article 16(4): 

“(5) Notwithstanding paragraph (3), a student who already holds an 
undergraduate qualification and commences a course listed in Part C of 
Schedule 2 of the Regulations which leads to an award that is of a higher 
level than their previous undergraduate qualification shall be eligible for a 
grant.”
text_norm: 15 article 16 principal scheme amended inserting following article 16(4) (5) notwithstanding paragraph (3) student already hold undergraduate qualification commences course listed part c schedule 2 regulation lead award higher level previous undergraduate qualification shall eligible grant

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 16. Article 26(4) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the
text_raw:
16. Article 26(4) of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the 

following: 

“(4) A grant is awarded for the normal duration of the approved course but 
is subject to renewal each academic year. Annual renewal will be based on 
compliance with the reckonable income limit of the relevant academic year 
and the student progressing from year to year within the course, having 
successfully completed the part of the course as required during the previous 
year. The student will also be required to have registered on and continue to 
attend the same course and to meet all other relevant provisions of this 
Scheme and schemes appropriate to each relevant academic year. Renewal 
is subject to the approval of the awarding authority each academic year. A 
student progressing from an approved course listed in Part C of Schedule 2 
of the Regulations to an approved course listed in Part D of Schedule 2 of 

 
 
 
 
 
 [426] 5 

the Regulations shall be treated for the purposes of this paragraph in the 
same manner as an applicant whose grant is subject to renewal.”
text_norm: 16 article 26(4) principal scheme amended substituting following (4) grant awarded normal duration approved course subject renewal academic year annual renewal based compliance reckonable income limit relevant academic year student progressing year year within course successfully completed part course required previous year student also required registered continue attend course meet relevant provision scheme scheme appropriate relevant academic year renewal subject approval awarding authority academic year student progressing approved course listed part c schedule 2 regulation approved course listed part schedule 2 426 5 regulation shall treated purpose paragraph manner applicant whose grant subject renewal

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 17. Schedule 2 of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the
text_raw:
17. Schedule 2 of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting the 

following: 

“SCHEDULE 2 

Eligible Long-term payments for the special rate of maintenance grant for the 
2023/24 academic year 

As at 31 December 2022, the reckonable income must include one of the eligible 
payments listed in this Schedule, or its equivalent from a Member State or a 
relevant specified jurisdiction, net of— 

(a) 

income disregards (as set out in article 22 (4) of this Scheme); and 

(b) Child Dependant Increase (C.D.I.), where paid by the Department of 

Social Protection. 

Social Assistance Payments
text_norm: 17 schedule 2 principal scheme amended substituting following schedule 2 eligible long-term payment special rate maintenance grant 2023 24 academic year 31 december 2022 reckonable income must include one eligible payment listed schedule equivalent member state relevant specified jurisdiction net of-- (a) income disregard (as set article 22 (4) scheme) (b) child dependant increase (c.d.i.) paid department social protection social assistance payment

title: of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011), and the Further and Higher
heading: 42. Grant aided employees in Community Services Programmes (formerly
text_raw:
42. Grant aided employees in Community Services Programmes (formerly 

social economy enterprises) 

* Combined periods of Jobseeker's Allowance and Jobseeker's Benefit and other 
eligible payments for purposes of meeting the prescribed period of 65 
consecutive weeks of unemployment during which an applicant was in receipt 
of either Jobseeker’s Allowance or Jobseeker’s Benefit. 

The Department of Social Protection Illness Benefit or COVID-19 Enhanced 
Illness Benefit or COVID-19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment or Maternity 
Benefit can also be used to combine periods of Jobseeker's Allowance and 
Jobseeker's Benefit provided a period of Jobseeker's Allowance or Jobseeker’s 
Benefit comes directly before and directly after the period of Illness Benefit or 
COVID-19 Enhanced Illness Benefit or COVID-19 Pandemic Unemployment 
Payment or Maternity Benefit. 

Periods on the Youth Employment Scheme/JobBridge, the National Internship 
Scheme, the Work Placement Experience Programme, can also be combined 
with periods on other listed eligible payments provided a period on an eligible 
payment comes directly before and directly after the period on the Youth 
Employment Scheme/JobBridge/National Internship Scheme/Work Placement 
Experience Programme.” 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, NDP Delivery and Reform consents to the 
making of the foregoing Scheme. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure, NDP Delivery and Reform, 

28 August, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 August, 2023. 

SIMON HARRIS, 

Minister for Further and Higher Education, Research, 
Innovation and Science.
